metadata.synopsis: The dryad from the circus of the last days is mastering a "Test your love" game, where player can ask a companion to participate and answer some questions about them for the approval rating.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug book, act 3, wyrm's crossing, circus of the last days. Go through the checkpoint, and Zethino is the dryad off to the right.

48.speaker: Zethino
48.text: There is violence afoot. Until it is resolved, I cannot in good conscience see any customers. Guard yourself, little one.

74.speaker: Zethino
74.text: You return, stira. Shall I look into your hearts, yours and your beloved's both, and see if your love will stand the test of time? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

179.speaker: Zethino
179.text: Violence erupts here - my home. My refuge in this city of stone and steel. Solace escapes me...
179.context: NodeContext: player failed the love test but zethino is trying to be gentle with them

200.speaker: Zethino
200.text: Your love may be wanting, little one, but your heart will find its path.
200.context: NodeContext: player failed the love test but zethino is trying to be gentle with them

279.speaker: Zethino
279.text: There is a great love amongst you - Zethino senses it. Bring your leader to me, and we shall see if your love is that of ages.
279.context: NodeContext: Player has tried to disguise themselves and try the love test again

380.speaker: Zethino
380.text: You have already sought Zethino's guidance, little one. Nurture and protect your love - for it is one of life's most precious gifts.
380.context: NodeContext: Player has tried to disguise themselves and try the love test again

438.speaker: Zethino
438.text: Your guise may fool the others, but Zethino knows your heart - you have already sought guidance. Let others have their turn.
438.context: NodeContext: Player has tried to disguise themselves and try the love test again

510.speaker: Zethino
510.text: This city of stone and steel is an endless scream in nature's womb. I have felt no peace here. Until now.

390.speaker: Zethino
390.text: Your eyes, stira. There is pain, endless and deep. But also devotion - blazing like the sun. You're in love, are you not?

312.speaker: Player
312.text: I do love someone - someone close to me, actually.

175.speaker: Zethino
175.text: You are wise to admit it. When it comes to love, vulnerability is armour. Truth, a sword. And trust, a shield. I pray you wield all three, stira.

137.speaker: Zethino
137.text: Bring the one you love. I will look into your hearts and see if your love is eternal. Or doomed eternally.
137.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

109.speaker: Zethino
109.text: Bring the one you love to me. I will look into your hearts and see if your love is eternal. Or doomed eternally. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
109.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I wish I could play, but I seem to be a little short.
116.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

56.speaker: Zethino
56.text: Return a time anew. With hearts, as well as pockets, full.

34.speaker: Player
34.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

278.speaker: Shadowheart
278.text: It can't hurt, I suppose - unless you embarrass me. Then you might find yourself hurting in a whole manner of ways.
278.context: NodeContext: Half-joking warning to a lover.

318.speaker: Zethino
318.text: Close your eyes, little ones. Be still as stone to earth. And remember to breathe.
318.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Players close their eyes, when they open them, they are somewhere like the meadow with daisy, or the waterfall from SH's romance. Zethino is a disembodied voice. 

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

145.text: Ah. Glorious. Your bond is sweeter than nature's dew. I see you. Know you. But do you know one another?
145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Players close their eyes, when they open them, they are somewhere like the meadow with daisy, or the waterfall from SH's romance. Zethino is a disembodied voice. 

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

478.speaker: Zethino
478.text: Ah. Glorious. Your bond is sweeter than nature's dew. I see you. Know you. But do you know one another?
478.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

337.speaker: Zethino
337.text: Shadowheart: an endless storm surges behind sharp eyes.
337.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

232.speaker: Zethino
232.text: Listen. Think. From where does Shadowheart draw comfort on a cold, dark night?
232.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

573.speaker: Player
573.text: Good company and an even better vintage.
573.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: Well put. Though I'll forgive a middling wine so long as the company makes up the difference...
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coy/flirty smile.NodeContext: Flirty/playful. Company being the player.

384.text: Your bond beats in pleasure. It is an honour to behold.
384.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player makes the first step towards the companion

168.speaker: Zethino
168.text: Your bond beats in pleasure. It is an honour to behold.

4.speaker: Zethino
4.text: Hear how your bond thrums with pleasure. Strong. Vital. Pulsing with affection.

373.speaker: Zethino
373.text: The heart craves comfort, but needs respect. How does one earn the dark-haired maiden's respect?
373.context: NodeContext: Approving. Second sentence jokingly spoken in a stage whisper.

239.speaker: Player
239.context: NodeContext: Approving. Second sentence jokingly spoken in a stage whisper.

502.speaker: Shadowheart
502.text: Very good. (Just don't say it so loud.)
502.context: NodeContext: Approving. Second sentence jokingly spoken in a stage whisper.

594.text: Our touch has been that of sunlight, but now we must ask the deep. The difficult.
594.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player takes a second step, moving even closer to the center for the trunk to the companion.

404.speaker: Zethino
404.text: Our touch has been that of sunlight, but now we must ask the deep. The difficult.

518.speaker: Zethino
518.text: The sweetest loves dance lightly on the tongue. But now we must dig deeper. Into the most painful reaches of the spirit.

301.speaker: Shadowheart
301.text: Not completely off the mark, but there's easier paths into my good graces...

365.speaker: Zethino
365.text: Do not fear - there is time yet. For our touch has been light, but now we must dig deep - deeper than any other.
365.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

440.speaker: Zethino
440.text: Shame sits in the soul of all - to tame it, we must name it. Shadowheart - what is her deepest shame?
440.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: She doesn't know who she is, or where she belongs.
82.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

52.speaker: Player
52.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

419.speaker: Player
419.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

354.speaker: Shadowheart
354.text: Hardly. My association with you might be a contender after that attempt...
354.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed. The player flubbed a question about what her deepest shame is.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Sacrificing an innocent for her own ambitions.
194.context: NodeContext: A bit of a raw nerve

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Failing her goddess when it counted the most.
46.context: NodeContext: A bit of a raw nerve

402.speaker: Shadowheart
402.text: I didn't think a little game would sting so much when I agreed to this... but you're right.
402.context: NodeContext: A bit of a raw nerve

432.speaker: Shadowheart
432.text: A perfect score - I'm flattered. Have you been studying up on me every night at camp?
432.context: CinematicNodeContext: The companion moves close to the avatar.

569.speaker: Shadowheart
569.text: A perfect score - I'm flattered. Have you been studying up on me every night at camp?

357.speaker: Zethino
357.text: I press my finger to your bond and find a shield - impenetrable. It is... beautiful.
357.context: NodeContext: Admiring, but with the sense there's a 'but' coming (IS ORIN)

128.speaker: Zethino
128.text: How close you are. Two hearts beating a perfect rhythm.
128.context: NodeContext: Admiring, but with the sense there's a 'but' coming (IS ORIN)

310.speaker: Zethino
310.text: But I know the truth. Only one face haunts your dreams each night. Close your eyes, sweetness, and she will come to you...
310.context: CinematicNodeContext: At Zethino's instruction the player closes their eyes -NodeContext: Getting creepy  (IS ORIN)

492.speaker: Shadowheart
492.text: You didn't do abysmally, I suppose. That's worth something.

439.speaker: Zethino
439.text: Your bond a seedling - one that needs a gentle hand in its tending. Nurture it and it will become a great oak, in time.

15.speaker: Zethino
15.text: Your love is one few have - cherish it.

391.speaker: Zethino
391.text: Go in peace, seedlings. And know that you made one whose heart was long quiet beat with love anew.

183.speaker: Zethino
183.text: Your bond is false, and I know why. Because your heart belongs to another.

244.speaker: Zethino
244.text: Close your eyes, and she will show herself to you.
244.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player closes their eyes - NodeContext: Getting creepy  (IS ORIN)

483.speaker: Orin
483.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
483.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Darkness as the dryad's vision ends. When the player opens their eyes, it is Orin stood before them. She smiles wickedly.

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

299.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
299.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Darkness as the dryad's vision ends. When the player opens their eyes, it is Orin stood before them. She smiles wickedly.

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

557.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
557.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Darkness as the dryad's vision ends. When the player opens their eyes, it is Orin stood before them. She smiles wickedly.

Extreme close-up on the eyes of player to help with the transition

487.speaker: Orin
487.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
487.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

335.speaker: Orin
335.text: You waste time soft-soothing these flesh bags for the knife.
335.context: NodeContext: Player demonstrated they have a strong bond with their closest companion. Orin practical - wy pretend to care when you'll only murder them anyway

81.speaker: Orin
81.text: You let such ruptured creatures swim in your blood wake. One little skull poke and you forget how to drown them.
81.context: NodeContext: Player showed they have a poor bond with their closest companion. Orin doesn't understand why you'd bother keeping them around. 'Skull poke' refers to her putting tadppole in your skull.

309.speaker: Orin
309.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
309.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

203.speaker: Orin
203.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
203.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

71.speaker: Orin
71.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

352.speaker: Orin
352.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
352.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

47.speaker: Orin
47.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
47.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

54.speaker: Orin
54.text: Your bond will not save you. He will wrap its cord around your neck and make you swing from it.
54.context: NodeContext: Player demonstrated they have a strong bond with their closest companion. Smug/superior - likes the idea you and your companion will suffer because of your bond. 'He' is Gortash, implying he might turn the player's love for the companion against them.

39.speaker: Orin
39.text: This wretch following in your worm wake won't help you. Your bond is brittle, the kind the tyrant longs to break.
39.context: NodeContext: Player showed they have a poor bond with their closest companion. Orin smug that you have such poor bonds with your allies. 'Worm' is the companion you did the quiz with. 'The tyrant' is Gortash, implication being he'll exploit the fact you aren't close to your allies.

362.speaker: Orin
362.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
362.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

480.speaker: Orin
480.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

235.speaker: Orin
235.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
235.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

249.speaker: Orin
249.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

178.speaker: Shadowheart
178.text: I suppose I should be grateful - you helped me shed any illusions that you might have been paying attention. Thank you.
178.context: NodeContext: Acidic. The player failed every single 'how well do you know your lover' question at a carnival attraction

302.text: A pity. I thought your bond a mighty oak. Instead, it is kindling - a brush of fire shall make it crumble.

70.speaker: Zethino
70.text: A pity. I thought your bond a mighty oak. Instead, it is kindling - a brush of fire shall make it crumble.

408.speaker: Zethino
408.text: But do not despair, seedlings. You are young - you will find love.

243.speaker: Zethino
243.text: It will simply not be with one another. Farewell.

474.speaker: Zethino
474.text: There is a hollowness between you, something brittle and strained. We must dig deeper. Grasp the pain hiding within.

511.speaker: Player
511.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mortified facial expression.NodeContext: Mortified

561.speaker: Shadowheart
561.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mortified facial expression.NodeContext: Mortified

397.speaker: Player
397.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

369.speaker: Player
369.text: The knowledge that she can change, just as sure as night will give way to day.
369.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

351.speaker: Player
351.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

520.speaker: Player
520.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

182.speaker: Player
182.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: I see. Are you sure you don't want to quit while you're behind?
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan facial expressionNodeContext: Unimpressed deadpan (the player guessed a 'know your spouse' carnival game question incorrectly)

311.speaker: Zethino
311.text: Your bond tears but it does not break - have hope.

473.speaker: Zethino
473.text: All affections face their trials. Your bond quivers, but it does not yet break.

599.speaker: Zethino
599.text: I see you. I see the bond between you. So tender. So fragile. But do you see it for yourselves?

454.speaker: Shadowheart
454.text: Love, is it? I hadn't realised I'd bowled you over that much. Give it a try, then - impress me.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: I say you'd better start looking for your true love, because it's not me.

355.speaker: Shadowheart
355.text: What do I say? Melon... donkey... sunrise? Whichever words will get you to leave me out of this.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: How about it, Lae'zel? Want to give it a go?

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: Yes. But be warned - I play to win.

103.speaker: Zethino
103.text: Lae'zel: passions of the heart and the blade wage war in her soul.

259.speaker: Zethino
259.text: Listen. Think. What does she most desire?

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: You know me as I know myself. Glory be to my queen.

187.speaker: Lae'zel
187.text: I would not be ascended - not by my own will, and not by Vlaakith's. Are you truly so indifferent to me?

282.speaker: Player
282.text: To find the truth about Orpheus amidst her queen's lies.

250.speaker: Lae'zel
250.text: You hear my words, you see my path. It is good to be known.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: Nonsense - my faith remains strong. Do you think so little of me that you'd believe this?

336.speaker: Lae'zel
336.text: Bah - trivialities. Have you been so inattentive?

102.speaker: Zethino
102.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what is the githyanki's fondest memory?

326.speaker: Player
326.text: The closeness of her kin at Crèche K'liir.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: What would you know of K'liir? I trained, I studied, I excelled. I had no need of friends.

171.speaker: Lae'zel
171.text: Mm. I took my pleasure, and it was done. I've devoted few thoughts to it since.

571.speaker: Lae'zel
571.text: A fateful night. I'm not apt to forget it - or who spent it with me.

514.speaker: Player
514.text: Tearing the limbs from the beasts of the Sea of Night.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: Well observed. There is no fouler scent - and no sweeter - than that of a neogi's blood.

193.speaker: Zethino
193.text: Life is brief - finite. When the warrior dies, what legacy will she leave behind?

556.speaker: Player
556.text: None. Her name will be lost to time.

231.speaker: Lae'zel
231.text: I suggest you stop speaking - for your own health, of course.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: She will live in perpetuity as a kith'rak atop a red dragon.

330.speaker: Lae'zel
330.text: All we have seen, all that has changed, and you still cling to old crusades.

386.speaker: Lae'zel
386.text: I should know not to underestimate you. You see me with clear eyes and open mind.

423.speaker: Lae'zel
423.text: An illuminating exercise. You've listened, if not always with both ears in attendance.

260.speaker: Lae'zel
260.text: I suppose I should be grateful - you helped me shed any illusions that you've been paying attention.
260.context: NodeContext: Acidic. The player failed every single 'how well do you know your lover' question at a carnival attraction

591.speaker: Lae'zel
591.text: Quite right. This is my fate, wrought by loyalty, entrusted to Vlaakith.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: She will be known as a liberator of the githyanki people.

293.speaker: Lae'zel
293.text: I will carry the truth to my people, whatever it might mean. Only time will tell how I'm remembered.

343.speaker: Lae'zel
343.text: Bah - my people already know liberty. Once, the illithids enslaved us; thanks to Vlaakith, we remain free.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: A vicious monster of legend, feared across the planes.

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: I will be feared, this much is true. As a monster? No. As a champion? Most certainly.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: She will take Vlaakith's place as Queen of the githyanki.

186.speaker: Lae'zel
186.text: You confuse fiction for fact. Even at my most loyal, I never longed for the githyanki throne.

544.speaker: Lae'zel
544.text: Vlaakith is the githyanki. I would never deign take the place of my Queen!

374.speaker: Lae'zel
374.text: A small delight, indeed. I did not want their friendship - I wanted their fear.

185.speaker: Lae'zel
185.text: Chk. I don't see the harm.

495.speaker: Lae'zel
495.text: Not today. Or any other time, come to think of it.

53.speaker: Lae'zel
53.text: I'd sooner slice off both my hands and feed them to a rabid boar.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: This could be fun, Karlach. What do you think?

413.speaker: Karlach
413.text: Yes, yes, yes! Let's do it!

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: Hah! Absolutely. This is gonna be great fun.

59.speaker: Zethino
59.text: Karlach: her fire within can incinerate an enemy or warm a beloved.

75.speaker: Zethino
75.text: Listen. Think. Who does she loathe above all others?

471.speaker: Karlach
471.text: She's the worst of the worst. I suppose a devil can't help her nature, but she's got a really godsdamn bad nature.

568.speaker: Zethino
568.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what is her idea of a perfect day?

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: I'd rather have my horns yanked out with a tweezers. Come on, give me a little action.

567.speaker: Zethino
567.text: There is a hollowness between you, a void that your futures may come to fill with darkness.

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Bashing baddies interspersed with victory sex.

585.speaker: Zethino
585.text: Our touch has been that of sunlight. But now we must look beyond - to the uncertain. To the future.

142.speaker: Zethino
142.text: The sweetest loves dance lightly on the tongue. But they sag and suffer with age. The future brings many trials.

271.speaker: Zethino
271.text: A decade from now, what will the mighty Karlach do? Where will she be?

554.speaker: Karlach
554.text: Honestly - probably. But hopefully not any time soon. I've got a lot of living to do yet.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Settled down in a quiet village with a nice partner and a few kids.

303.speaker: Karlach
303.text: Kids, huh? I don't know. How about a really mean goat.

387.speaker: Karlach
387.text: But... I don't know. Things can change I guess. I've heard.

234.speaker: Karlach
234.text: You really know me, don't you? It's wild. In so many ways, we barely know each other. But where it counts, you're deeper in my head than that tadpole.

578.speaker: Karlach
578.text: You did pretty well there, soldier. I have to say, I'm impressed.

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: Well. I think we've proven here today that we really don't know each other very well, do we? Ah well. There's time.

143.speaker: Karlach
143.text: She's nice. But I'm more of a sunlight girl myself.

274.speaker: Player
274.context: NodeContext: Saying she would never hate the player, so with fondness

586.speaker: Karlach
586.text: Just the sound of his name makes my blood boil - probably literally. Can't stand the fucker. Ding ding.

543.speaker: Player
543.context: NodeContext: Saying she would never hate the player, so with fondness

256.speaker: Karlach
256.text: I'd be highly entertained if he choked on a button. But I don't hate him, per se.

69.speaker: Player
69.context: NodeContext: Saying she would never hate the player, so with fondness

226.speaker: Karlach
226.text: Excuse you! I think not. Not ever.
226.context: NodeContext: Saying she would never hate the player, so with fondness

415.speaker: Zethino
415.text: The bond wavers, but we have only just begun. Have faith.

120.speaker: Karlach
120.text: Mmm, I don't think so. Seems a little... I don't know. Just no.

340.speaker: Karlach
340.text: With you? Please. That story's written in stone, and it ends with you on one side of the world and me on the other.

267.speaker: Player
267.text: Astarion, are you up for this?
267.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: Oh my love, how could I say no?
113.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

314.speaker: Zethino
314.text: Astarion: a tumultuous past hides behind a mirthful grin.
314.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

84.speaker: Zethino
84.text: The heart is fraught, so let us begin with the joyous. When is he happiest?
84.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

300.speaker: Player
300.text: I don't think he's ever been happy.
300.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

159.speaker: Astarion
159.text: Excuse me? I've been happy, thank you very much.
159.context: NodeContext: Response to "I don't think he's ever been happy"

448.speaker: Astarion
448.text: I'm not right now, but whose fault is that?
448.context: NodeContext: "I'm not happy right now, but whose fault is that?"

93.speaker: Player
93.context: NodeContext: responding to "he's happiest when he's killing people"

216.speaker: Astarion
216.context: NodeContext: responding to "he's happiest when he's killing people"

539.speaker: Zethino
539.text: Many things delight the heart, but only one makes it sing. Tell me, what does he desire more than anything?
539.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

339.speaker: Player
339.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

570.speaker: Astarion
570.text: Oh you're very sweet. I wouldn't say no to some gory vengeance personally, but that was an adorable answer.

251.speaker: Player
251.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

368.speaker: Astarion
368.text: You're not wrong, but do we need to tell every stranger we meet our business?
368.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

547.speaker: Zethino
547.text: Fear sits in the soul of all - to tame it, we must name it. Astarion - what is his deepest fear?
547.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

273.speaker: Player
273.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

347.speaker: Astarion
347.text: You're very funny, did I ever mention that?
347.context: NodeContext: Not impressed with the attempt at a joke

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: Ha! Well, when you look this good...

532.speaker: Astarion
532.text: Well... You were right every time. I almost wish you hadn't been, but you do know me...

446.speaker: Astarion
446.text: I have to say, you know me better than I thought. I'll have to be more mysterious in future.

392.speaker: Astarion
392.text: Well, that was a disaster. Can we call time on this farce? Please?

332.speaker: Player
332.text: Forever feeling like a slave to someone else.

135.speaker: Astarion
135.text: Really? I mean, yes, but - really? You'd tell whatever stranger just walked up and asked?

68.speaker: Zethino
68.text: That which needs to be said is often the most difficult. Take pride - you are one step closer to conquering your fears.

528.speaker: Zethino
528.text: There is no need for secrecy here. You wear your truth so close to the skin.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: Oh I like that answer. Yes, let's go with that.

280.speaker: Zethino
280.text: I cannot, little one. I can accept truth, and only truth - and you know that is not what lies within your hearts.

11.speaker: Zethino
11.text: You betray yourselves. A bond based on lies will one day be severed.

467.speaker: Player
467.context: NodeContext: Response to "more than anything he wants revenge"

35.speaker: Astarion
35.context: NodeContext: Response to "more than anything he wants revenge"

512.speaker: Astarion
512.text: Urgh, really? Of all the things you could think of - that?

45.speaker: Player
45.text: He's happy right now - look at that smile!

396.speaker: Astarion
396.text: It's a grimace, sweetie. Not off to a great start.

240.speaker: Astarion
240.text: Oh I'm the one you love? Well my dear, how could I say no?
240.context: NodeContext: refusing to take a 'love test' from a dryad

265.speaker: Astarion
265.text: A sweet gesture, but all... this? It's not really for me.
265.context: NodeContext: refusing to take a 'love test' from a dryad

409.speaker: Astarion
409.text: Wait, I'm the one you love? Oh no - oh that's so sad.
409.context: NodeContext: shocked, laughing - someone he didn't like just asked Astarion to take a love test with them

331.speaker: Astarion
331.text: But no, there's absolutely no way this is happening.
331.context: NodeContext: amused, but emphatically refusing to take a 'love test' from a dryad

190.speaker: Player
190.text: This sounds like fun, Wyll. Want to try?

258.speaker: Wyll
258.text: I'm more than game. Let's do it.

189.speaker: Wyll
189.text: Why not? Could be good for a laugh.

372.speaker: Zethino
372.text: Wyll: the courageous heart tormented by the infernal.

173.speaker: Zethino
173.text: Listen. Think. What, on his darkest day, would make him smile?

424.speaker: Player
424.text: Memories of our first night getting to know each other.

590.speaker: Wyll
590.text: Indeed. You were a source of light among shadows. Still are, for that matter.

184.speaker: Zethino
184.text: We cannot live this life without others - others to guide us. To aspire to. Who does the Blade most admire?

327.speaker: Wyll
327.text: Hells. Have I fallen so far from your favour?

286.speaker: Wyll
286.text: Hardly. Astonishing that you'd even utter her name.

458.speaker: Wyll
458.text: Indeed. We've not always seen eye to eye, but his every thought, every act, was in service to his people. Among men, there is none greater.

333.speaker: Wyll
333.text: May he be at peace. We did not see eye to eye, but his every thought, every act, was in service to his people. Among men, there was none greater.

416.speaker: Zethino
416.text: Life is a difficult and tumultuous thing. With every smile, a tear often follows. What is Wyll's greatest regret?

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Her face still haunts me. If I could make the sun rise in the west, reverse the Chionthar's waters, I'd spare her my folly.

382.speaker: Wyll
382.text: You know me, you understand me. And for that, I'm forever grateful.

115.speaker: Wyll
115.text: This was good fun! You know me fairly well, it turns out.

515.speaker: Wyll
515.text: Together we've shed blood, shared words. Yet you've learned so little.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Sparing Karlach and becoming a devil.

531.speaker: Wyll
531.text: No - we acted justly. That Karlach still lives is a delight worth celebrating, not lamenting.

431.speaker: Wyll
431.text: The Hells threatened to swallow the city. I made the only choice I could.

174.speaker: Wyll
174.text: Truly spoken. All he'd done for Baldur's Gate, for its people... He earned a better fate than the one Gortash gave him.

376.speaker: Player
376.text: Leaving behind his father - and his city.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: He gave me no choice. But it's true. I often wonder - what if I'd said the right words, made the right promises?

411.speaker: Wyll
411.text: Maybe I'd have been with him on the journey from Elturel. Maybe there'd be no Absolute, no infections, no... this.

398.speaker: Wyll
398.text: It pains me to hear you say it. We shared a bond, or so I thought. Does it mean nothing to you?

319.speaker: Player
319.text: Balduran, the great hero of Baldur's Gate.

140.speaker: Wyll
140.text: Yes - a hero in all senses. A courageous explorer and a just spirit. A pity to see what's become of him.

406.speaker: Wyll
406.text: Yes - a hero in all senses. A courageous explorer and a just spirit. Would that we all aspired to his greatness.

316.speaker: Wyll
316.text: A mug of nutty darndarr and a plate of cured meats? It's no Mount Celestia - but it's close.

112.speaker: Wyll
112.text: You'd have been right, not so long ago. But things have changed - a different time, a different Blade.

564.speaker: Player
564.text: The day he made his pact.

379.speaker: Wyll
379.text: A necessary step for my city's future. The Hells' fires ran red hot that day; I don't remember it fondly.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: I don't think so. But I appreciate the offer.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: Well, Minsc - what say we give it a go?
165.context: NodeContext: Player has just propositioned Minsc to have their prospects as lovers estimated by a dryad - tone is affectionate

245.speaker: Minsc
245.text: Minsc is flattered, but surely you must know that his heart is already of the hamster shape. And twice as fuzzy.
245.context: NodeContext: Player has just propositioned Minsc to have their prospects as lovers estimated by a dryad - tone is affectionate

72.speaker: Minsc
72.text: ...Boo? Does our friend know another Minsc? One that they might be courting, perhaps?
72.context: NodeContext: Player has just propositioned Minsc to have their prospects as lovers estimated by a dryad - tone is dumbfounded, a stage whisper to Boo

276.speaker: Player
276.text: Jaheira, this could be entertaining - let's give it a go.

430.speaker: Jaheira
430.text: I'm flattered, but pick another. Watching the dryad make you cry will be entertainment enough.

78.speaker: Jaheira
78.text: Hm? Oh, the dryad is comely enough - but you? Don't poke at questions you don't want the answer to, cub.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Sounds magical - what say you, Gale?

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: Thoroughly magical. Let's have at it.

593.speaker: Zethino
593.text: Gale: the learned wizard. The charming gentleman. The walking apocalypse.
593.context: InternalNodeContext: for loca - spotted dick = pudding type dessert

395.speaker: Zethino
395.text: Listen. Think. If the wizard were given the choice, what food would he be?
395.context: InternalNodeContext: for loca - spotted dick = pudding type dessert

461.speaker: Player
461.text: A lemon meringue - tart and lightweight.
461.context: InternalNodeContext: for loca - spotted dick = pudding type dessert

118.speaker: Gale
118.text: Do you think so little of me? At least you didn't compare me to a spotted dick...
118.context: InternalNodeContext: for loca - spotted dick = pudding type dessert

133.speaker: Zethino
133.text: The heart is fraught, so let us turn to the joyous. When is Gale happiest?
133.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed and offended

596.speaker: Player
596.text: At dusk. The light favours his complexion.
596.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed and offended

427.speaker: Gale
427.text: You make me sound like some preening peacock. I am not that bad.
427.context: NodeContext: A little embarassed and offended

378.speaker: Player
378.text: While on his balcony in Waterdeep.

403.speaker: Gale
403.text: Bravo. That is indeed where my mind wanders to, when times are hard...

353.speaker: Gale
353.text: Once, perhaps. But those passions have soured.

526.speaker: Zethino
526.text: We often gaze through a veil of roses, but love accepts both the petal and the thorn. Gale - what is his greatest flaw?

450.speaker: Player
450.text: He's too enraptured by illusions and fantasies, neglecting what's real.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: I have worse failings, I fear. Far worse.

491.speaker: Player
491.text: He's too eager to please, no matter the cost.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: He thinks he, and the world, might be better off if he were dead.

555.speaker: Gale
555.text: Hearing it said out loud - yes, I fear it is true. Fate seems determined to make a sacrifice of me.

338.speaker: Gale
338.text: But perhaps fate can yet be defied...

574.speaker: Gale
574.text: A perfect score. It seems you know me better than I know myself.

412.speaker: Gale
412.text: It seems you've been paying attention to me - though there is always room for improvement.

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: I've had a little stone caught in my boot the last while - clearly that makes for a better travelling companion than you do.

485.speaker: Player
485.text: A shiny red apple - wholesome as can be.

151.speaker: Gale
151.text: Ah, the fruit of scholars. How I long to have a troop of loyal students grace me with apples by the orchard-full in exchange for wisdoms imparted...

134.speaker: Player
134.text: A three-day-old pot of tavern stew - muddled and questionable.

551.speaker: Gale
551.text: I'm not opposed to a bowl of something mysterious and rib-sticking, but I certainly don't identify as one.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: A roast onion - versatile, with hidden layers.

513.speaker: Gale
513.text: An apt metaphor - though I hope it won't lose me some kisses.

367.speaker: Gale
367.text: Perhaps you're overestimating my affection towards you a tad? You'd better seek a partner-in-embarrassment elsewhere.

592.speaker: Gale
592.text: No thank you. Sounds as appealing as milking cottage cheese directly from a geriatric cow.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: Minthara, my dear, shall we show this dryad how it's done?

213.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
213.text: I know my heart - and yours - better than this creature ever will. But we can indulge it if you wish.

164.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
164.text: Fine. But if this creature can truly look into my heart, it best be careful what it reveals.

464.speaker: Zethino
464.text: Minthara: a mask of ice hides a heart of pure fire - you do well to call her close.

2.speaker: Zethino
2.text: Listen. Think. What does the drow miss most about the Underdark?

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Picking off her siblings one by one.

209.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
209.text: Not just siblings. Androcide, senicide, avunculicide - I only regret I left before enjoying a matricide. That would be a memory to cherish.

131.speaker: Zethino
131.text: Many pass through our lives, their touch rippling across time. But who does Minthara admire the most?

420.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
420.text: Please. I'd rather spend my nights with a drider than with that do-gooder and his pussycat.

550.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
550.text: If I admired nobody I would travel alone. You have earned my admiration. And more.

220.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
220.text: Presumptious. But not inaccurate. You have earned my companionship - that is no easy task.

429.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
429.text: I think not. The gods are more fickle than the fools who follow them.

536.speaker: Zethino
536.text: Those with an icy façade hide their true selves well - but pain breaks us all in the end. What is the worst thing your love has ever done?

445.speaker: Player
445.text: Slaughtering the tieflings at the grove.

144.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
144.text: I barely remember the grove... I was not myself. But my only regret is that I exerted myself in the name of a false god.

381.speaker: Player
381.text: Let herself be captured by the cult of the Absolute.

83.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
83.text: I do not know what weakness of mine allowed them to take me.

18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
18.text: That haunts me more than anything they did to me.

121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
121.text: You know my heart, and I am glad. You are the first.

208.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
208.text: Are we finished? You were only mildly disappointing. Well done.

269.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
269.text: I had always kept my heart hidden, but I allowed you to see it. To see me. It saddens me that you saw a stranger instead.

489.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
489.text: Without Lolth or the Absolute, I am free for the first time. Some may call it exile, I call it independence.

394.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
394.text: Self-deprecation is not endearing. It is demeaning.

188.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
188.text: Spiders are Lolth's creatures - as was I. Her cult controlled me just as the Absolute did. Not a pleasant memory at all.

289.speaker: Player
289.text: Spending time with her beloved family.

177.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
177.text: There was no love to be found. My mother would have poisoned her own milk to torment me.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Spiced Ulaver wine and thinly sliced rothé steak.

287.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
287.text: It is true. Surface food lacks flavour. House Baenre banquets were legendary.

85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
85.text: The creature need not look into our hearts to see that I barely tolerate your existence.

582.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
582.text: No. And if you refer to me as 'my dear' again, I will cut out your tongue.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What do you think, Halsin? Shall we put ourselves to the test?

20.speaker: Halsin
20.text: Gladly. We each know the other's heart to the fullest - there is little to fear here.

130.speaker: Zethino
130.text: Halsin: nature's gentle steward - and furious defender.

597.speaker: Zethino
597.text: Listen. Think. When is he most comfortable?

498.speaker: Player
498.text: While in the form of a bear, clad in nothing but fur.

577.speaker: Halsin
577.text: A fair assumption. Perhaps not the truest answer of all, but still in good judgement.

315.speaker: Zethino
315.text: We strive to do our utmost - to prove ourselves worthy. Tell me - of what is Halsin most proud?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: His physique. Who can blame him?

268.speaker: Halsin
268.text: No, that is not right. My body is but a vessel to serve nature with. To take pride in it is to indulge in vanity.

479.speaker: Zethino
479.text: Life is full of victory and loss. You cannot have one without the other. Halsin - what is his greatest failure?

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Appointing a fanatic as his second-in-command at the grove.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: Perhaps not my greatest failure, but a sizeable one, yes. My faith in Kagha showed... poor judgement, put mildly. Very mildly.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: Allowing the shadow curse to blight nature for a hundred years.

14.speaker: Halsin
14.text: It is true. Nature suffered, while I dawdled, and allowed myself to be distracted.

521.speaker: Halsin
521.text: The curse is no more, true. But imagine if I had been faster, bolder, better. Lives would have been saved. More than I care to count.

141.speaker: Halsin
141.text: But I must move on. Nature demands that I do.

469.speaker: Halsin
469.text: I had high expectations, but even still, I am impressed. You may know me better than I know myself.

228.speaker: Halsin
228.text: You understand me almost perfectly. Only my late mother may have bested you.

484.speaker: Halsin
484.text: An... unfortunate result. Perhaps we should not have partaken.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: That he somehow let some scrawny goblins capture him.

523.speaker: Halsin
523.text: No... that wasn't my most glorious moment, but my greatest failure? Far from it.

223.speaker: Player
223.context: NodeContext: A little scolding and disappointed

124.speaker: Halsin
124.text: No, you are mistaken. Rejecting unwanted advances is no failure, even if it earned me some scars.
124.context: NodeContext: A little scolding and disappointed

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Saving his friend Thaniel and banishing the shadow curse.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: This is the truth. I sense I will never surpass that moment, when nature awoke from its nightmare.

152.speaker: Halsin
152.text: Pleasant, vivid memories, yes. But my greatest source of pride? No.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: Protecting his grove from those who threatened it.

598.speaker: Halsin
598.text: A source of pride, true. I can think of greater feats, but that one is cherished all the same.

542.speaker: Player
542.text: After a supper large enough to induce hibernation.

199.speaker: Halsin
199.text: Mindless gorging...? No, that is not right. I did not realise you thought that of me.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Comfort doesn't come naturally to him - he's restless and roaming.

272.speaker: Halsin
272.text: This is the truth - I live for the wilderness. Comfort is for the farm animal, snug in its pen.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: At his study in the grove.

443.speaker: Halsin
443.text: Scholarly pursuits are important... but my heart lies elsewhere.

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: I thought you may have bestowed the honour on someone else. But if this is what you wish, so be it.

202.speaker: Halsin
202.text: I suppose we've braved greater dangers together than public embarrassment. Do as you wish.

572.speaker: Halsin
572.text: You flatter me... but also overestimate our bond, I think. Perhaps there is another you can turn to.

524.speaker: Halsin
524.text: Nature is my true love. You, I merely tolerate.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: I have someone in mind - let me go get them.

579.speaker: Zethino
579.text: I await with a heart full and happy - eager to begin.

575.speaker: Player
575.text: Like I need a dryad to tell me what I feel.

389.speaker: Zethino
389.text: Your words are cruel, but your heart quivers. Love is a tangled forest - there is no shame in seeking guidance. Think on it.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I have no time for love.

360.speaker: Zethino
360.text: Love blossoms in life's furies - you have formed bonds in this time, have you not? Trust. Respect. These are clothes that love dresses in.

158.speaker: Zethino
158.text: Everyone loves - even those who wrap their hearts in stone. I can help you see that love more clearly.

560.speaker: Zethino
560.text: You return, stira - good. Violence is like fire - it burns all those in its path. I feared you caught in the flames.

459.speaker: Zethino
459.text: Do you wish to speak of love, little one? For Zethino is here to help - always. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

563.speaker: Zethino
563.text: This city of stone and steel is an endless scream in nature's womb. I have felt no peace here. Until now.

581.speaker: Zethino
581.text: You return, stira. I pray the hearts of you and your companion are ready - for love is a fragile blossom, and we will test its resilience. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

87.speaker: Zethino
87.text: Why do you keep calling me 'stira'?

477.speaker: Player
477.text: Why do you keep calling me 'stira'?

400.speaker: Zethino
400.text: Forgive me - I had not realised. My beloved, before she died, was a woman of great strength and fortitude. I called her stira in our quiet moments.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: What do you say, Shadowheart? Do you want to try this?
